intro: Chamaecytisus albus f. pallidus, commonly known as the pale flowering broom, is a compact, shrub-like plant native to southern Europe. It features small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. The plant has slender, arching stems covered in fine, silvery-green foliage. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a border plant. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
